description: From Latin manducatus, past participle of manducare (“to chew”). See manger.

verbs.description: manducate (third-person singular simple present manducates, present participle manducating, simple past and past participle manducated)

examples: If we manducate bread , then 'tis capable of all the natural alterations , and it cannot be denied . But if we manducate Christ s body after a natural manner , what worse thing is it that it descends into the guts than that it goes into the stomach
